metadata.title: Influence of viral infection on expression of cell surface antigens in human retinal pigment epithelial cells

abstract.original_text: vival of viruses in the infected cell, favoring establishment of persistent infection. Our observation in cultured human RPEC indicates that this mechanism might indeed contribute to the development of disease affecting retinal tissue.

Our observation in cultured human RPEC indicates that this mechanism might indeed contribute to the development of disease affecting retinal tissue .
